Other than that\, it plays wonderfully; the combat has been massively streamlined since the first game\, where I often felt the combat was a bit of a chore. Obviously the game looks great\, and the acting is top notch. While the first game focused on the relationships between a small handful of characters\, Part 2 explores the wider world of The Last of Us\, giving the player an interesting insight into how the rest of the country is coping (or not...). This is occasionally a detriment to character development\, as we are introduced to so many new faces\, but nonetheless I found the overarching story to be an enthralling rollercoaster of a journey. While it can’t quite match the simplicity and intimacy of the first game\, it succeeds in telling a challenging story\, and opens up a world of possibilities as far as any potential sequel is concerned.… Expand
